org.jvoicexml
Interface Session

All Known Implementing Classes:
JVoiceXmlSession, SessionStub
public interface Session

A session begins when the user starts to interact with a VoiceXML interpreter context, continues as documents are loaded and processed, and ends when requested by the user, a document, or the interpreter context.

A Session can be obtained via the JVoiceXml.createSession() method.

A client usually performs the following method calls to interact with the interpreter:

  1. call
  2. hangup
  3. close

The call method returns immediately. In case of an error the client does not get notified. In order to monitor the call and retrieve error messages, clients should use the waitSessionEnd method. This may be done synchronously right after the call method call or asynchronously in a thread.

Version:
$Revision: 222 $

Copyright © 2005-2007 JVoiceXML group - http://jvoicexml.sourceforge.net/

Author:
Dirk Schnelle
See Also:

getSessionID

Retrieves the universal unique identifier for this session.

Returns:
Universal unique identifier for this session.
Since:
0.4

call

void call(URI uri)
          throws ErrorEvent
Handles a call request.

Starts processing of the given application and returns immediately.

Parameters:
uri - URI of the first document to load.
Throws:
ErrorEvent - Error initiating the call.

hangup

void hangup()
            throws ErrorEvent
Handles a hangup request.

Throws:
ErrorEvent - Error terminating the call.
Since:
0.4

getCharacterInput

CharacterInput getCharacterInput()
                                 throws NoresourceError
Retrieves the DTMF input device.

Returns:
DTMF input device.
Throws:
NoresourceError - Input device is not available.
Since:
0.5

waitSessionEnd

void waitSessionEnd()
                    throws ErrorEvent
Delays until the session ends.

Throws:
ErrorEvent - Error processing the call.
Since:
0.4

close

void close()
Closes this session. After a session is closed, it can not be reopened i.e., to call another application.

If no hangup call was initiated, the session is aborted.
